					<item>
			<title>Times Square hugger punches Ottawa woman in face over tip dispute</title>
			<link>http://www.brandonsun.com/national/breaking-news/times-square-hugger-punches-ottawa-woman-in-face-over-tip-dispute-379301151.html</link>
													
						<description>NEW YORK, N.Y. - A man offering "free hugs" in New York's Times Square is accused of punching a Canadian tourist in the face after she refused to tip him for his hug and a photo.

Jermaine Himmelstein was arrested on robbery and fraudulent accosting charges shortly after the Thursday afternoon...</description>
			<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:49:04 CDT</pubDate>
		</item>
					
					<item>
			<title>Swimming mishap off Cancun, Mexico claims life of Ontario man</title>
			<link>http://www.brandonsun.com/national/breaking-news/swimming-mishap-off-cancun-mexico-claims-life-of-ontario-man-379300231.html</link>
													
						<description>CANCUN, Mexico - A Kitchener, Ont., truck driver has drowned while swimming off the coast of Cancun, Mexico.

Zoltan Zadori was in the water with his wife, Cindy McPherson, on Wednesday when the couple was swept out to sea.

McPherson says the waves were very strong and kept pulling them further</description>
			<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:31:03 CDT</pubDate>
		</item>
					
					<item>
			<title>Court orders Manitoba lawyer fined and sentenced to 15 months for tax evasion</title>
			<link>http://www.brandonsun.com/national/breaking-news/court-orders-manitoba-lawyer-fined-and-sentenced-to-15-months-for-tax-evasion-379289961.html</link>
													
						<description>WINNIPEG - A Manitoba lawyer has been fined nearly $100,000 and given a 15-month sentence after being found guilty of tax evasion.

Brian Langford of Birtle, Man., argued in court that the federal government didn't have the right to directly tax income earned in Manitoba, under the British North</description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:14:04 CDT</pubDate>
		</item>
					
					<item>
			<title>Conservatives and NDP say Trudeau's wife shouldn't get extra staff</title>
			<link>http://www.brandonsun.com/national/breaking-news/conservatives-and-ndp-say-trudeaus-wife-shouldnt-get-extra-staff-379283581.html</link>
													
						<description>OTTAWA - The opposition parties are making some political hay over media reports that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's wife wants extra staff to help manage her official duties.

Sophie Gregoire was quoted this week in the Quebec City newspaper Le Soleil as saying she is overwhelmed by the crush</description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:57:00 CDT</pubDate>

					<item>
			<title>B.C. Health Minister predicts record drug overdose deaths this year</title>

						<description>VICTORIA - British Columbia's health minister says he's hopeful the rate of drug overdose deaths will start dropping this month as a result of action taken by the province to curb a disturbing spike in opioid-related fatalities.

So far, last month's declaration of a public-health emergency</description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:25:05 CDT</pubDate>
		</item>
					
					<item>

						<description>MONTREAL - Bill Morneau told Quebec business leaders on Thursday he's always appreciated the province's open and friendly climate — but this time Canada's finance minister wasn't talking about investment.

					<item>

						<description>WINNIPEG - Manitoba's new Progressive Conservative government has laid down spending restraints for all government departments while it gets a handle on the province's financial picture.

					<item>
			<title>Team of firefighters haul struggling half-tonne horse from frigid P.E.I. pool</title>
			<link>http://www.brandonsun.com/national/breaking-news/team-of-firefighters-haul-struggling-half-tonne-horse-from-frigid-pei-pool-379250911.html</link>
													
						<description>NORTH WILTSHIRE, P.E.I. - A horse named Shanty is back in the pastures of rural Prince Edward Island thanks to the heavy lifting skills of a team of volunteer firefighters who pulled her from a frigid swimming pool on Wednesday night.

North River fire chief Anson Grant says it wasn't easy for</description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:21:03 CDT</pubDate>
		</item>
					
					<item>
			<title>Sorry, Trump: Canada isn't committing to doubling defence spending</title>
			<link>http://www.brandonsun.com/national/breaking-news/sorry-trump-canada-isnt-committing-to-double-defence-spending-379250391.html</link>
													
						<description>WASHINGTON - Canada isn't committing to a massive boost in military spending, such as is being demanded of U.S. allies by Donald Trump as part of his presidential election platform.

Defence Minister Harjit Sajjan was asked during a visit to Washington about the request that NATO allies meet</description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:15:06 CDT</pubDate>
